014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
022import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.DefineFactory;
023
024/**
025 * Defines a named attribute as the argument passed to the annotated parameter.
026 * Attributes are stored on the {@link StatementContext}, and may be used by
027 * statement customizers such as the template engine.
028 */
029@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(DefineFactory.class)
030@Target(ElementType.PARAMETER)
031@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
032public @interface Define {
033    /**
034     * The attribute name to define. If omitted, the name of the annotated parameter is used. It is an error to omit
035     * the name when there is no parameter naming information in your class files.
036     *
037     * @return the attribute name.
038     */
039    String value() default "";
040}
